page.title: 04Agriculture Amberley RACKHAM
page.content: There are three farms in the area. Parham, Kithurst, and Springhead covering flatland and Downland. The valley bottom is cultivated and the Downs are mainly used for grazing with land to the south beyond the South Downs Way again cropped. The livestock is mainly dairy herds, Friesian with some store cattle and sheep on enclosed grazing. Crops grown are winter wheat and barley with some kale and rape. The cereal crops are harvested by combine and carted in open trailers to the drying sheds. Stubble is fired. Ploughing and re-sowing follows. Early grass is cut for silage for winter fodder, and the fields then grazed.
